title: Understanding the WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause is used to filter records in a SQL query. It specifies the condition that must be met for the records to be selected.

title: Syntax of the WHERE Clause
text: The correct syntax for the WHERE clause is: WHERE $$column_{name}$$ operator value. For example, WHERE Street $$=$$ 'Poplar'.

title: Using Operators in WHERE Clause
text: Common operators used in the WHERE clause include $$=$$, <>, >, <, $$ \geq $$, $$ \leq $$, BETWEEN, LIKE, and IN.

title: Identify the Correct WHERE Clause
text: Which of the following is the correct syntax for filtering records where the Street is 'Poplar'?
